name: Mocoví
period: 1999-2009 fieldwork, plus early 20th-century fieldwork by R. Lehmann-Nitsche, which continue to be the main source on the astronomy of indigenous people of the Guaycurú linguistic group
place: communities centered around Colonia Cacique Catán, and other communities in the region such as Colonia Aborigen Chaco and Colonia Aborigen El Pastoril (Chaco Province, Argentina)
description: The Mocoví (or Moqoit) are an indigenous people of the Gran Chaco in South America. The present-day Mocoví population consists of 18000 people, most in the Argentine provinces of Chaco and Santa Fe. The Mocoví language belongs to the Guaycurú linguistic group, as do the Toba, Abipones, Pilagás and Caduveos. Before coming under the influence of missionaries, they were migratory hunters (the favored species of game animals were deer, peccaries, and rheas), fishers, and gatherers. Today, the Mocoví have become assimilated, their culture has undergone substantial change, and only a minority have retained their native language. They had and still have a great practical knowledge of the night sky, for orientation and time-telling. The celestial plane, one of the three planes of the Mocoví cosmos, is called Piguim. This is a cold region, where atmospheric phenomena (winds, rain, thunder, lightning) belong. The celestial plane is hostile to humans, but is inhabited by powerful beings who look like the Mocoví but belong to mythical time, owners of astronomical and atmospheric phenomena. The vast majority of these celestial inhabitants are women: the celestial (and many Mocoví constellations) are associated with abundance, since almost all of the water in this region of Chaco is rain water. Most of the Mocoví asterisms are within or near the Milky Way, which acts as an articulating axis of the Mocoví cosmos. There are 12 identified constellations (of which 9 lined), and names for many sky objects. The source identifies stars and draws some line figures. Another Corral of the Dog (native: Qo'parit pioq) (similar to CON Mocovi 001) has not been identified.

constellations.description: These stars form the crown of the tree; very faint stars form the trunk, and dark spots of the Milky Way form the roots. The tree is linked to a story about the abundance of goods, which can be obtained when signs appear near the tree.
Represents a trunk used as a pan to ferment the carob, in particular the hole in the trunk through which the drink is taken out. It is located very close to CON Mocovi 004.

constellations.description: These stars are associated with a story about two little brothers abandoned in the mountains. They escape a powerful lady, the 'owner of the mountain', with help from two doves (CON Mocovi 007). Body parts of the dead lady are transformed into two dogs (CON Mocovi 008) which chase the owner of the rheas, Mañic (CON Mocovi 009).

NAME Large Magellanic Cloud.description: One of a pair of water wells, together with the other Magellanic Cloud. According to some Mocoví, when there was a great drought, one approached the Temale and there he obtained water.
Place where carob flour was made. Its whitish colour is the carob flour.
Huge pots where the Mocoví ate.

NAME Pleiades.description: This is considered the creator of the Mocoví, or the founder of their lineage. The heliacal rise of these stars marked the beginning of the year.
Their brood of the rheas of which the male is the Coalsack Nebula; the abundant offspring serve as food for the Mocoví.

* alf Sco.description: A bird of prey, identified by some Mocoví with the star Antares. Together with two others, the Pohe and the Ratecsan (red-headed and black-headed jotes) play interchangeable roles in Mocoví stories about the flood and the theft of fire. The bird steals lit firebrands from the chief of the mountain, flies away setting fire to the mountain, from which the Mocovíes get the fire, so they eat cooked meat.
A red-headed, bald jote bird, identified by some Mocoví with the star Aldebaran and by others with the star Antares. The name might designate any bright red star that is visible at a given time.

NAME Milky Way.description: Identified as the riches of the sky, with a celestial river of gifted fish where the Mocovíes went to fish while climbing the tree in the sky, and with the path of a rhea farm, of which the male is the Coalsack Nebula.

NAME Coalsack Nebula.description: There is also a female rhea in a nearby spot near the star alf Sco.
